intro: Melanthera albinervia, commonly known as the white-veined Melanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with prominent white veins. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warm season. Melanthera albinervia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
